[ library(queues) | The ECLiPSe Libraries | Reference Manual | Alphabetic Index ]

list_jump_queue(List, OldQueue, NewQueue)

adds all the elements of List at the front of the queue

Description

adds all the elements of List at the front of the queue. There are two ways we might do this. We could add all the elements one at a time, so that they would appear at the beginning of the queue in the opposite order to the order they had in the list, or we could add them in one lump, so that they have the same order in the queue as in the list. As you can easily add the elements one at a time if that is what you want, I have chosen the latter.
